byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

abstract: Kurdish militias engage Syrian government forces in country's northeast, further complicating conflict after collapse of tenuous truce and peace talks.
lead_paragraph: Kurdish militias and President Bashar al-Assad’s forces tend to avoid clashes, but skirmished Thursday in the de facto Kurdish autonomous region.

headline.main: Kurds and Syrian Forces Clash, Adding Wrinkle to War
headline.print_headline: Kurds and Syrian Forces Clash, Adding a Worrying Wrinkle to a Complex War

snippet: Kurdish militias and President Bashar al-Assad’s forces tend to avoid clashes, but skirmished Thursday in the de facto Kurdish autonomous region.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
